resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/103034</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>103034</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086939</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">"The first vote."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">"die erste Stimme."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">"la première voix."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">"o primeiro voto."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">"il primo voto."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">"Η πρώτη ψηφοφορία."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">"el primer voto."</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">An 1867  Harper's Weekly  illustration features three figures symbolizing black political leadership: a skilled craftsman, a sophisticated city dweller, and a Union Army veteran.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Eines Harpers die wöchentliche Abbildung 1867 
kennzeichnet drei Abbildungen, die schwarze politische Führung 
symbolisieren: ein erfahrener Handwerker, ein hoch entwickelter 
Stadtbewohner und ein Anschluß-Armeveteran.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">L'illustration 1867 hebdomadaire d'un Harper comporte 
trois figures symbolisant la conduite politique noire : un 
artisan habile, un habitant sophistiqué de ville, et un vétéran 
d'armée des syndicats.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">A ilustração 1867 semanal de um Harper caracteriza três
figuras que symbolizing a liderança política preta: um 
artesão hábil, um morador sofisticado da cidade, e um veteran do 
exército de união.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">L'illustrazione settimanale 1867 del Harper caratterizza 
tre figure che simbolizzano la direzione politica nera: in un 
artigiano esperto, un abitante specializzato della città e un 
veterano dell'esercito del sindacato.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Εβδομαδιαία χαρακτηριστικά γνωρίσματα απεικόνισης 
ενός 1867 Harper τρεις αριθμοί που συμβολίζουν τη μαύρη 
πολιτική ηγεσία: ένας ειδικευμένος βιοτέχνης, ένας 
περίπλοκος κάτοικος πόλεων, και ένας παλαίμαχος στρατού ένωσης.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La ilustración semanal 1867 de un Harper ofrece tres 
figuras que simbolizan la dirección política negra: un 
artesano experto, un habitante sofisticado de la ciudad, y un veterano
del ejército de unión.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>
            <entity>BEGIN:VCARD
N:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
FN:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086939</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">No License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>103034</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/libraries/the-first-vote</uri>

    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
